definition: authentic (painting or calligraphy)/genuine work (of famous artist)
Huang Binhong (1865-1955), art historian and literati painter
Chang Dai-chien or Zhang Daqian (1899-1983), one of the greatest Chinese artists of the 20th century
interpreting words/to explain the meaning of words in classic texts/to decipher an old script
to record/to put down in writing
handed down from ancient times/family heirloom
blue-and-green landscape (genre of landscape painting originating in the Tang dynasty, in which blues and greens predominate)
to inscribe a poem (often, composed on the spot) on a painting, fan or ceramic bowl etc as a work of calligraphy/an inscribed poem
